page.title: 08HELSBY HILL RACES
page.content: The original hill races were held as an athletic event many years ago but stopped in l957. They were restarted two years ago to raise funds for a new scout hut. The races are sponsored by local firms whose names are acknowledged in the titles of various trophies. There are races for boys, youths, men and women and there are also team races. Many local people participate encouraged by special awards for locals. Teams also compete from as far away as Leeds, Halifax and Bolton. The races are run under A.A.A. and W.A.A.A.rules. The races start and finish at the Public Playing Fields in Lower Robin Hood Lane where local organisations are encouraged to hold stalls and fund raising activities.
